name: Hyatt Regency Hua Hin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought the hotel was well placed, far enough out of the centre of Hua Hin but easily accessible using the green buses which cost 10-15 baht. They run between Thao Takiab and Hua Hin and then on to the local airport. However far you travel the price is the same.
reviews.title: AN ENJOYABLE STAY AT THE HYATT REGENCY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was well up to our expectations of a 4 star hotel and the gardens were beautiful. the pool was large with the added benefit of a lazy river running around the grounds where you can also swim. Please take note however that during our stay which was Nov/Dec there is no accessible beach as the tide is right in for most of the day (maybe starts going out at about 5.00pm but it starts to get dark shortly after this, so you cannot swim or walk along the beach in this area. Eating in the hotel is expensive but at the bottom of the drive on a Fri, Sat and Sun is the Cicada Market which has great atmosphere and a dozen "upmarket" food stalls offering amazing food at very cheap prices.
reviews.title: You don't need to leave the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for a quiet few days after plenty of days partying on our holiday. This was perfect. The Hyatt is peaceful, quiet and elegant. It summarises the best of a Thai beach holiday with the great massages, yummy breakfast, excellent grilled fish, and nice beach.
reviews.title: great quick getaway
Great relaxing and beautiful holiday
reviews.text: The beach is clean and quiet. The hotel has these lovely beach deck chairs on the beach patio, which is the best place to read and listen to music. (up until sunset after which the mosquitoes will come and eat you alive!).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I absolutely loved the main swimming pool, which is like a mini-stream that meanders its way through the property, flowing by restaurants, under quaint bridges, up past the bar etc. Although our room had a private swimming pool, it was so much more fun in the main one.
reviews.title: Very best stay at the Barai
Recommended
reviews.text: Big family hotel in Hua Hin. Great pool facilities, especially a nice slider in one of the pools. (See other guests' pics). highly recommended for children.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK rooms, great service which you'd expect from large chain hotel, especially in Thailand.
reviews.title: Breathtaking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No complaints whatsoever.
reviews.title: Relaxing holiday

reviews.text: We decided to stay at this hotel due to word of mouth from friends, eventhough the way to the hotel was abit far from the main city and the hotel's location is hidden in a small alley, but the moment we arrived at the main lobby we were impressed with the design and the warmth of the staffs. My attention span just shrunk and was like an excited 6 yr. old wanting to run around and see more of the hotel. The thing that impressed us most was the amazing pool of theres, we did not need to leave this property even if they tried to force us to. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Good place but can get better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 2 week stay at this hotel and cannot rate it highly enough.All the staff are very friendly and always smiling, wanting to please and make your stay special. We stayed in a Regency Club room and found the service exceptional. The quality of food in all the restaurants was excellent and good value. The food in the club lounge was also excellent with plenty of variety and never ran out even when the hotel was very busy. Management team members were often in the lounge and always asked if everything was alright and what could they do to make our stay better. The answer was always - nothing!
reviews.title: The renovated regency club is a great improvement

reviews.text: My wife and I have been to Hua Hin 3 times in the last 10 months. On 2 of those occasions we have stayed at the Hyatt.
reviews.title: Absolutely love this place...!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Why did we not stay at the Hyatt on one of those trips? Who knows. But it was a mistake...
reviews.title: Fantastic place, well recommended, excellent staff and hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is by far the most enjoyable we have stayed at. And this includes other hotels in other locations, such as Bali, Phuket, Penang etc....
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, charming staff and excellent facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the Hyatt are absolutely superb. Our most recent stay, 10th to the 20th of May, saw us arrive at the hotel at 9 am. And yes, our room was not ready. We never expected it to be. But within half an hour, they had 2 rooms ready for us, (our daughter came on this trip).. And I cannot thank them enough for this.
reviews.title: A much improved hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent most of the day around the pool. Which is the best in Hua Hin. Bar none...
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay at wonderful Hyatt Regency Hua Hin
A perfect honeymoon
reviews.text: We stayed at the presidential villa, premier suite and the barai pool suite when we made a stopover at hua hin while travelling from bangkok to phuket and from phuket back to hua hin during our honeymoon trip. The rooms are spacious and the service offered by the suite butlers are second to none. They are very friendly and helpful and makes us feel very much at home.

Although we had encountered some booking problems with agoda.com for our 2nd stay here ( we initially booked for a barai suite but ended up being downgraded to the premier suite due to a technical problem with agoda.com) , Khun Yee Man Timm, the spa director here at the Barai did an excellent job in making our stay a memorable one despite the setback. In addition, we would like to mention that the massages at the Barai are the best we had ever experienced in the world and it is definitely worth a try for all the spa enthuthiasts out there!
reviews.title: A good try with kids

reviews.text: We have struggled to choose a newer hotel but far away from Hua HIn town but finally, we choose Hyatt Regency - close enough to down town with a nearly private beach. As my husband and teenager kids want relaxed in the 4-day stay, I choose Hyatt Regency because of the big beach side swimming pool, lazy river, water slide. We have spent a full day, a full afternoon and a full morning at the pool side, facing the beach. The river and slide gave us lots of fun besides sun-bathing and swimming.
reviews.title: happy staff, happy guest

reviews.text: Lucky that our stay is over the weekend with the Cicada market open just right in front of the hotel. We really enjoy he street side performance, tasty food, arts display and buy some souvenirs
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Only comment is that the room is a bit small and without free wifi.
reviews.title: Has Not Moved With The Times

aka: Hyatt Regency Hua Hin Hotel Hua Hin
description: Hyatt Regency Hua Hin is a premier beachfront resort ideal for families, honeymooners and couples who are looking for a relaxing and enjoyable vacation. The hotel enjoys a 250 meter stretch of prime white sand beach, plus lush tropical gardens and swimming pools. THE BARAI, the hotel's brand-new residential suite and luxury spa destination, is a sanctuary for beauty, pampering and wellness.
